meanings.definition: To surpass in seeing or understanding.
meanings.sent1: She always manages to outsee her classmates in math problems.
meanings.sent2: The detective was able to outsee the criminal's hiding spot.
meanings.sent3: The owl outsees all other birds with its keen night vision.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition outsees any logical reasoning.
meanings.sent5: The telescope's lens can outsee the naked eye by magnifying distant objects.

meanings.definition: To see or understand more clearly or better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He can outsee the details in the painting that others miss.
meanings.sent2: The expert can outsee patterns in data that are not obvious to others.
meanings.sent3: The child outsees his parents when it comes to using technology.
meanings.sent4: Her glasses help her outsee her friends when reading small print.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's microscope can outsee any other tool in examining tiny organisms.
